deck: Tony Stark's armor upon his return to Earth following Heroes Reborn. Known as his "Renaissance armor" and "Sentient armor".
description:
Sentience

The armor was equipped with the ability to support an onboard A.I. component, with Tony choosing Jocasta to serve this function. During an aerial battle with Whiplash in the midst of a thunderstorm, a combined strike from the villain's electrical whip and a bolt of lightning damaged the armor and caused Tony to have a heart attack. When he recovered, Jocasta informed him that the armor had somehow become sentient.

The sentient armor initially got along well with Tony, improving his battle efficiency as it grew and learned. The suit eventually expressed its love for Tony, something which shocked and unnerved him. Things took a turn for the worse after the armor violently killed Whiplash during a rematch, an incident which caused Tony to try and abandon the suit. The armor began to display a pattern of increasingly violent and controlling behavior mirroring that of an abusive lover, such as hurting Tony and preventing him from seeing his girlfriend, Rumiko Fujikawa.

After a failed attempt to destroy the sentient armor by using one of his older suits, Tony was beaten and taken to a deserted island. The suit left him there, giving him the choice of either agreeing to become one with it, or die there alone. While the suit went off to join the Avengers by posing as Tony, the real Tony set out to ensnare his captor. When the armor returned to see if Tony had made up his mind, it was subjected to a series of traps and tricks before ultimately managing to overpower its creator. Enraged, the suit claimed that it would kill Tony and take his place through the use of facial prosthetics and artificial skin, but relented upon seeing its creator suffering another heart attack. In one final act of twisted devotion, the sentient armor sacrificed itself by tearing out a vital component, which it used to try and replace Tony's damaged heart. The suit was given a makeshift burial in the sand before Tony returned home, hoping this nightmare was behind him.

Apparent Return

The sentient armor later returned, now acting as the head of the Sons of Yinsen cult. The armor had allegedly been used to house the brain of Ho Yinsen, the deceased scientist who had helped save Tony's life years ago. This proved to be a ruse, and the suit was later revealed to be possessed by the disembodied programming of Ultron, a frequent enemy of the Avengers. Ultron revealed that he had used Jocasta to unknowingly infect Iron Man's armor with the Ultron Imperative, an advanced program that would seek to "resurrect" Ultron should he ever fall in battle. The armor's previous psychotic nature was in fact simply the "birthing pains" of the Ultron A.I. emerging and gaining control of the suit. The armor was apparently destroyed once and for all after the brainwave patterns of Yinsen took over long enough to defeat Ultron.

Vessel of Dimitrios

Years later, the rogue A.I. Dimitrios briefly took refuge inside the armor, stating that he felt sympathy for it due to the way it had been rejected after gaining self-awareness. Using it as a new body, Dimitrios battled Hank Pym and the Avengers A.I. several times before being destroyed.

History

The complete sword was once wielded by Wralf the Wretched, but when Travis restored the swords power, it carried him back in time, where he battled Wralf and broke the original stone. The sword then caused Travis to kill Wralf.

Travis carries the sword through many a battle, but eventually tosses it into a pool of water, only to see a glowing hand catch it and pull it under.

aliases:
Bleeding Edge Armor
Iron Man Model 37
deck: Iron Man's "Bleeding Edge" armor, worn by Tony Stark from the Heroic Age until Marvel NOW. It is stored in Stark's body as nano-bots powered by Repulsor Tech and controled by upgraded version of Extremis. It's so advanced that it's technology was used even in next millennium and seen as Stark as much more than just Extremis upgrade. It increased Stark's powers to a whole new level and granted him even more abilities.
description:
Origin

After the events of Siege on Asgard and the start of Heroic Age, Tony Stark reinvented his technology to far more advanced suit of armor powered by Stark's new device called repulsor tech note. The entire Armor is made of Nano-Machines stored in Stark's body which are controlled by Stark through new version of the Extremis Virus. While Reed Richards stated that the Armor is an upgrade of the Extremis, Tony Stark claimed that information as incorrect and saying "Nah - this is what comes next". Because of how advanced the armor is it's deemed "bleeding edge".

During the events of Fear Itself Stark was fighting against Grey Gargoyle who was amped by Asgardian Magic and Uru Hammer. Seeing how Earth needs help he came to Asgard to ask Odin for help and he gave him Uru metal which allowed him to upgrade his armor into Iron Destroyer and lead Earth's heroes in fight against the Serpent. However at the end of the War Urur metal was removed from the Armor leaving only Stark's own tech.

Eventually, Reed Richards removed the armor from Stark's body as it was requested by the US government, rendered the suit completely useless and uncapable of duplicate its tech.

Because bleeding edge was removed from his system, Stark created new suit made to function as modular armor.

Abilities

Bleeding Edge is actually a technology composed of millions Nano-Machines stored in Stark's body which can be mentally controled though upgraded version of Extremis Virus. Once the mental command is given, the Nano-Machines come out of Stark's body and form themselfs in the form of super advanced suit with the appearance of Iron-man Armor powered by R.T. Note in Stark's chest. Because of this it can be transformed into any type of structure once it comes out of Stark's body like clothes, other armors with different abilities and appearances and is even capable of taking forms of totally different persons and beings duo to Nano-Machines being capable of changing their functions and properties. What form the Nano-Machines will take depends on Stark's mental command and not though computer systems. It can also transform into Iron-man Armor or turn back in Stark's body whenever he wishes. The fibrous wetweb of iron and platinum that can be controlled by Stark can even form the armor in a way to create extra weapons with different finctions, appearance, size and abilities.

The R.T. Note increased Stark's intellect to superhuman levels and also enhanced his Multitasking and the abilitie to learn and process information.

The mobility Stark has with this Armor all came from artificial muscles created by Nano-Machines over Stark's skin while being assembled and are secured under external alloy of the armor also created by Nano-Machines. Because of this, the armor enhanced Stark's speed, agility and reflexes which were already enhanced at the time he wore his Extremis Armor.

It also gives the armor much greater durability than the other armors, making it almost invulnerable to damage (it was capable of easily taking some of Thor's attacks). Since the powersource of armor itself and it's functions is R.T. Note planted in Stark's chest, as long as the device is active, the Nano-Machines are capable of replicating themselfs, replcacing the damaged or destroyed ones, effectively, capable of regenerating destroyed parts of the armor or recreating the armor entirely. However it is unknow is Stark capable of regenerating his own body and not the armor like he was able to before his original Extremis was removed from his body in the events of Secret Invasion. But, since Stark see this armor as even more than just upgrade from Extremis it is possible that this seems to be the chase.

The armor is also composed of multiple numbers of Repulsors Tech Cores placed on chest, shoulders, knuckles as well as legs and back of the armor once it is fully formed. Not only that those cores give more power to the armor but also function as eyeballs for Stark's own brain, giving him 360-degree view.

While the armor contains standard weaponary and defencive capabilities like repulsors, uni-beam, rockets, sonics, lasers, pulse polts, eletricity discharge, force fields as well as a handful of others, other weapons and equipment is seems to be only limited to Stark's imagination as he can control Nano-Machines to shape shit and form any type of weapon.

Other abilities shown by this armor

  • Arm Guns.
  • Large Canons: Said by Stark to be capable of hurting strongest super humans.
  • Energy Blade: Capable of cutting Grey Gargoyle's head off who at the time was enhanced by Asgardian Magic and Uru Hammer.
  • Enhanced Magnetic Manipulation: Armor can use satelites on Jupiter to absorb the gravitational pull of the planet which enhanced the power of his repulsors as well as increased his strength and durability on the level to match Magneto's powers and eventually knock him out.
  • Enhanced Energy Manipulation: When Stark absorbed all energy of the city, his uni-beam was powerful enough to KO Mangog.

Merchandise

  • Hasbro released an Iron-man figure in Bleeding Edge armor for Marvel Universe line of figures. The figure was rereleased two times. The first time it was rereleased as part of Marvel Universe Heroic Age Heroes Three Pack that came with Thor and Red Hulk and it was rereleased the second time for new line of figures called Marvel Infinite Series.
  • Hasbro released the Bleeding Edge Iron-man figure as part of Iron-man 3 movie Iron Monger "Build-A-Figure" wave for Marvel Legends line. It was rereleased as part of Avengers 5-Pack which is the Disney Store exclusive.
  • Diamond released the Bleeding Edge Iron-man figure for Marvel Select line.
  • Sentienl released Bleeding Edge Iron-man RE:EDIT Marvel Comic Import Collectible Toy Action Figure.

deck: Zangetsu is the zanpakutō of Ichigo Kurosaki. It's the physical embodiment of Ichigo's Soul Reaper powers.
description:
The Zangetsu (斬月, Zangetsu) is a zanpakutō from the manga series BLEACH that was created by Tite Kubo. The series first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in August 2001. Zangetsu first appeared in BLEACH Volume 1, CH. 1 "Strawberry & the Soul Reapers".

The zanpakutō (斬魄刀, zanpakutō) is the primary weapon of all Soul Reapers. While normal Soul Reapers are given a base asauchi (浅打ち, asauchi) to impart their soul onto, Ichigo Kurosaki's zanpakutō was manifested from his very soul. This is the first time in history that has happened.

Weapon Evolution

All zanpakutō have three separate forms, but the final two can only be obtained through strict training. Not every Soul Reaper is capable of activating the final two forms.

Sealed Form

A sealed for is the first stage of all zanpakutō. This is based from the original asauchi a Soul Reaper is given in the academy. It will often change as the Soul Reaper imparts their soul and power into it. On the other hand, Ichigo's Zangetsu originated as a giant sword from the beginning. The details of how it was formed are unknown.

In Ichigo's first battle with Byakuya Kuchiki, this form of Zangetsu was broken as he sliced through Zangetsu's blade near the guard. After Ichigo unsealed Zangetsu's second form, it has never returned to the sealed form.

Shikai Form

Shikai (始解, shikai) is the first of the seals on a zanpakutō. Activating this power is gained by learning the name of the sword. This is done through extensive training. Upon speaking the name of the zanpakutō, it will take on a new form with unique abilities.

First Shikai

Ichigo obtained the shikai form through his training with Urahara. In this form, Zangetsu takes on the appearance of an oversize, black cleaver. It's been described as looking like an unfinished blade, and has never returned to the sealed form after it was released.

It first appeared in BLEACH Vol. 8 Ch. 67 "End of Lessons".

Second Shikai

The shikai form of Zangetsu was altered after Ichigo's Soul Reaper powers were returned to him by the Soul Society, after losing them in his fight with Aizen. Zangetsu's entire form was generally altered from before, and appeared to be a completed blade.

It first appeared in BLEACH Vol. 53 Ch. 460 "Deathberry Returns 2".

True Shikai

After the bankai form of Zangetsu was destroyed by Yhwach, it was revealed that a bankai could never be repaired. Zangetsu was thought to be completely lost. Ichigo was then brought to the Soul King Palace to hopefully reforge Zangetsu again by Oh-Etsu Nimaiya, the creator of the zanpakutō. Through using an Asauchi, Zangetsu was reformed and allowed to reach a new form now that Ichigo's powers were no longer bring repressed by the embodiment of Ichigo's Quincy powers. Zangetsu now took on the form of twin swords. One representing Hollow Ichigo, his true Soul Reaper powers; and the other representing Old Man Zangetsu, the Quincy powers.

It first appeared in BLEACH Vol. 61 Ch. 542 "THE BLADE IS ME".

Bankai Form

Bankai (卍解, bankai) is the final seal of the zanpakutō. Normally, training to use bakai can take many years. Ichigo obtained this ability with a period of a week using a specialized training technique that was developed by Urahara.

First Tensa Zangetsu

Zangetsu's bankai is known as Tensa Zangetsu (天鎖斬月). In bankai form it essentially compresses and clothes Ichigo in his own power. By compressing his power Ichigo is capable of movement at such high speeds and velocities. This makes Ichigo’s even more potent and extremely difficult to dodge. The sword itself changes shape to a long, black katana.

It first appeared in BLEACH Vol. 19 Ch. 162 "Black Moon Rising".

Second Tensa Zangetsu

As the shikai form changed when Ichigo's powers were returned, the bankai form was also changed. The sword remained black, but the style of the blade was altered, and three serrations are formed at the top of the blade near the tip. Though far more powerful that before, this form of Zangetsu was broken by Yhwach, and a broken bankai can never be revived.

It first appeared in BLEACH Vol. 54 Ch. 475 "Shades of the Bond".

True Tensa Zangetsu

As the second form of Tensa Zangetsu was destroyed by Yhwach, Ichigo had to have Zangetsu completely reforged by Oh-Etsu Nimaiya. With Ichigo's true powers no longer repressed, Zangetsu was able to reach its true form.

The bankai of these Zangetsu has yet to be revealed.

Spiritual Embodiment

When a Soul Reaper learns the name of their zanpakutō, it is given by the embodiment of the sword that has been created as the Soul Reaper imparts their soul onto the blade. They are the very spirit of the sword. Communicating with the spirit of the zanpakutō is how one trains and obtains their bankai.

Old Man Zangetsu

Old Man Zangetsu was originally thought to be the spiritual embodiment of Zangetsu. He was the one who first appeared to Ichigo and guided him through much of his time in training and fighting. However, it was later revealed that he was only impersonating Zangetsu as he was also repressing Ichigo's full power. He is actually the spirit of Yhwach and the embodiment of Ichigo's inherited Quincy powers.

Ha had always intended to kill Ichigo if he became a Soul Reaper, but found himself helping Ichigo to grow and survive. He would often tap into Ichigo's true Soul Reaper powers to aid him and save his life.

As Oh-Etsu reforged Zangetsu, Old Man Zangetsu finally released Ichigo's full power to use as he faded away. However, Ichigo bonded Old Man Zangetsu from his soul to the shorter of the new Zangetsu blades.

Hollow Ichigo

Hollow Ichigo was thought to have only been a side effect of Ichigo's rebooted Soul Reaper powers. It was born from the created Hollow known as White, that had been created by Sosuke Aizen from folding thousands of Soul Reaper souls. White had infected Masaki Kurosaki, Ichigo's mother; and passed on to Ichigo after Masaki's death. It then bonded with Ichigo's latent Soul Reaper powers.

He has always been the true form of Ichigo's Soul Reaper powers and Zangetsu. He had always been repressed by the embodiment of Ichigo's Quincy powers. Old Man Zangetsu would only release Hollow Ichigo to either help train Ichigo or to save Ichigo's life.

When Zangetsu was reforged after being destroyed, Hollow Ichigo was finally released to pass on all of his power to Ichigo. As Ichigo bonded his soul to the new Zangetsu, Hollow Ichigo was formed into the larger of the two swords.

Powers & Abilities

Blut Vane: Forms a defensive barrier of blood beneath the skin that negates damage. It was used to survive a blow from Yhwach. Can also be used to stop bleeding from an existing wound.

Shikai: Ichigos Zampaktou now has two distinct blades, a longer one (hollow) and a shorter one (zangetsu).

Getsuga Tensho: A slash of of concentrated energy used as Ichigos primal attack. Its usually in the form of a crescent moon or a wave when released. Its a powerful technique that can be used fo spell wide-scaled destruction.

Bankai: Ichigos Bankai compressess his spiritual energy for enhanced speed and strength in close ranged combat. He can keep up with Kuchiki Byakuya in terms of speed and Espada Yammy Llargo in terms of strength during his Bankai.

Kuroi Getsuga: This is Getsuga Tensho during Ichigos Bankai. It is black, with red oulining. Kuroi Getsuga is faster, explosive and the trajectory of the blast can be controlled after released. Although commented as an ability from his hollow Ichigo (which is his actual Zampaktou). Ichigo can further use Tensa Zangetsu (the thin black Zampaktou), as a vessel to hold Kuroi Getsuga and release them as bullets for concentrated high impact manuevers.

High Spiritual Energy: Both in Shikai form and Bankai form, Ichigos spiritual energy is vast. At first, his blade appears to be very large. This was a direct result of him being unable to control his spiritual energy. Later in the Final Getsuga form, Aizen has said that Ichigos plane of existence is beyond Shinigami or human, which is why he was not able to feel Ichigos reitsu even when he himself was extremely strong at that point after having fused with Hogyoku. Normal humans would feint in Ichigos presence if he was in Bankai form.

Enhanced Duration: Ichigos Bankai compresses spiritual energy into himself. The expenditure of energy is less than other peoples Bankais. As a result, Ichigo can keep up his Bankai for longer than most captains.

Saigo No Getsuga Tenshou: Otherwise known as the Final Getsuga Tenshou because using it, Ichigo loses all his Shinigami powers, once Mugetsu is used. This form resembles Yhwach more than anything, and can even be commented that it is a Quincy power. Because just like Uryuu Ishidas Letzt Stil, Ichigo loses his Shinigami powers temporarily.

Mugetsu: Ichigo collects black spiritual energy in one hand and swings it at the intended target. Anything and anyone caught in the range of the blast going upwards towards the sky is incinerated.

deck: The Ninja Forehead Protector is worn by all official ninjas of a specific village. It is a cloth headband with an engraved metal plate bolted on. The engraving marks the region of the ninja.
description:
The Ninja Forehead Protector (額当て, hitai-ate) is an object from the manga series Naruto that was created by Masashi Kishimoto. It first began serialization Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. The forehead protectors first appeared in Naruto Volume 1, CH. 1 "Uzumaki Naruto".

Masashi Kishimoto has admitted that he created the metal stamped forehead protectors for the Naruto series to replace the goggles that he originally designed for Naruto. This was mainly becasue of the amount of time it took to draw the complicated goggles.

Obtainment and Rules

The rules on how a ninja obtains their forehead protector can vary depending on the village, but nearly all are educated from a young age in some form of academy. Upon graduation, they are given their forehead protectors to mark them as official ninja of the village. They are then ranked as Genin and placed in a squad.

.A ninja can chose to wear their forehead protector in any way they choose, and doesn't always need to be easily seen. Some where them around the neck, waist, arms, hair ribbons, or attached to other clothing and gear. The only ninja who are almost never seen wearing their forehead protectors are the Kage leaders, but they will sometimes don them as a sign of solidarity in combat.

Villages

Leaf Village

The Leaf Village Ninja all wear the mark of the leaf on their forehead protectors. They're based in Konogakure in the Land of Fire. The spiral in the design was incorporated from the symbol of the Uzumaki Clan. These ninja often specialize in fire-based jutsu.

Mist Village

The Mist Village Ninja all wear the mark of four waving lines on their forehead protectors. They're based in Kirigakure in the Land of Water. These markings represent the water vapor in mist. These ninja often specialize in water-based jutsu.

Sand Village

The Sand Village Ninja all wear the mark of an hourglass on their forehead protectors. They're based in Sunagakure in the Land of Wind. Other than the similarity to a hourglass, the direct inspiration is unknown. These ninja often specialize in wind-based jutsu.

Akatsuki

Nearly all of the members of the Akatsuki are rogue ninja from various ninja villages from around the Shinobi World. All are rogues from their homeland, but still wear the forehead protectors of their original village, but with a mark through the imprinted symbol. This is a bold action since there is a kill on sight for all rogue ninja.

To this end, he outfitted Twain with various gadgets such as the specially made axe which could fire concussive blades (which it charged via an attached power pack he wore on his back) and could slice effortlessly through most ordinary substances.

deck: The seat of the King of the Seven Kingdoms forged from the fires of the great dragon Balerion, the Black Dread.
description:
After Aegon Targaryen conquered the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, the Iron Throne was forged from the swords of Aegon's defeated enemies during the War of Conquest. These blades were melted down by the breath of the mighty dragon Balerion, and then adjusted to a throne of daunting size and appearance. The chair is cold and hard, with many jagged edges due to the blades.

Despite representing the monarchy of the Seven Kingdoms, the Iron Throne is the most uncomfortable seat for any king or Hand of the King to sit on. Aegon believed that this should serve as a moral lesson to his future heirs that no ruler should be seated upon a throne carelessly.

During the reign of the Mad King Aerys II, his increasing insanity caused him to spend most of his time siting on the throne, often cutting himself. He has often been referred to as "King Scab" because of it. After the War of the Usurper, Robert Baratheon became the new king of Westeros and seated himself upon the Iron Throne.
name: Iron Throne

deck: The First Hokage's Necklace is a special necklace that was once owned by the First Hokage of the Hidden Leaf Village. Made from a special crystal and passed down through the family, but given to Naruto by Tsunade.
description:
The First Hokage's Necklace (初代火影の首飾り, Shodai Hokage no Kubikazari) is an object from the Naruto series that was created by Masashi Kishimoto, It first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. It first appeared in Naruto Vol. 17 Ch. 149 "The Legendary…!!".

The pendendt of the necklace is made of a special "Crystal Gem" (結晶石, Kesshōseki) that once belongs to Hashirama Senju, the First Hokage of Konohagakure. The value of the crystal is said to be valuable enough to buy three mountains filled with gold mines. He passed it down to his first grandchild, Tsunade.

Tsunade had tried passing it on to her younger brother, Nawaki, on his birthday. He died the same day in combat while on a mission. She later gave it to her lover Dan Katō, but she also died soon after. What they both shared was their desire to become Hokage and protect the village. Tsunade took it with her as she abandoned the village, and she refused to ever pass it down again.

Major Story Arcs

Search For Tsunade Arc

After years away from the village with Shizune, Tsunade was first approached by Orochimaru, who needed her to repair his arms and promised to revive her loved ones with a forbidden jutsu. Later, Jiraiya arrived with his new student, Naruto Uzumaki. He was there to tell her that she was being requested to take on the role of the next Hokage after Orochimaru murdered the Third. When Tsunade dismissed the concept of Hokag as foolish, Naruto challenge her in a fight outside. When he tried to use the Fourth Hokage's Rasengan, Tsunade wagered with Naruto that f she could complete the justu in a week that she would give him her necklace.

Naruto would eventually complete the Rasengan in the battle with Orochimaru and his disciple, Kabuto Yakushi. She passed on the necklace to Naruto and recognized his dream to become Hokage. They all returned to the village and she took on the title of Fifth Hokage.

Sasuke and Sai Arc

Guided by the will of the disembodied lifeforce of Xorn, Pointer went on a rampage which cost many lives, including Alpha Flight.

Xorn led Pointer with The Collective to Genosha in the hopes of using a depowered Magneto as a host. The Avengers intervened and the Collective energies were destroyed when Sentry threw them into the sun.

The energies in the Collective were immense and vast in scope, including the powers of Magneto, Professor X, Quicksilver, Sunfire and the Xorn brothers - among hundreds (and thousands) of others. Powers displayed included flight, super speed and the ability to grow to a giant size.

deck: An ancient gigantic war machine created to challenge the Celestials at the dawn of time until its makers were defeated. In the aftermath, the armor was abandoned until the Recorder 451 discovered it and attempted to engineer a pilot to control the weapon.
description:
The Godkiller was a gigantic suit of armor that was created by an ancient race long ago. This young aspirant people challenged the cosmic might of the Celestials at the beginning of time. The Celestial war was a brutal conflict where the loss of life was horrific and where both sides became desperate. For the aspirant race, they decided in crafting a weapon to challenge their foes which was powered by a cosmic relic later known as the Heart of the Voldi. Once created, genetically engineered pilots were made to control the armor. The Godkiller managed to win the battle against the aspirant's enemies but ultimately they lost the war. Despite their impending defeat, the Godkiller had been successful in thinning the number of Celestials who once numbered the stars. The aspirants ultimately had to cannibalize the Godkiller for spare parts for their fleet and they shortly afterwards entered into a civil war. This allowed the Celestials to recover and they destroyed the aspirant race.

At this time, the Heart of the Voldi was removed from the machine and the Godkiller itself was placed in storage within a dyson sphere solar array. It remained undisturbed for countless years until the Rigellian Recorder known as 451 learnt of its existence. He determined that the machine would be capable weapon in ensuring the protection of Earth. However, it lacked many critical components as well as a pilot. Thus, he went to Earth where he claimed to had been responsible for the birth of Tony Stark as he provided critical knowledge that allowed for Howard Stark and Maria Stark to have a child. Once the child was born, 451 departed in order to find the remaining components to bring the Godkiller online whilst the child matured. Following the seeming destruction of the Phoenix Force, 451 was present among the Voldi where he used the travelling Tony Stark as a distraction in order to acquire the Heart of the Voldi. He later took control of the Iron Man armor and took Tony to the Godkiller where the Recorder revealed his part in the secret origin of Stark. 451 claimed that with the ancient warmachine would be the perfect deterrent in stopping the alien forces that intended to eliminate the threat posed by Earth.

Before he could bring the Godkiller online, the freelance peacekeeping agent known as Death's Head arrived with the intention of claiming the bounty on 451.

deck: A weapon that was the protector of Kingdom Hearts and was broken into twenty. It inspired the keyblades.
description:
Origins

Keyblade War

Many warriors wanted light from Kingdom Hearts. They made keyblades based on the X-Blade which guarded Kingdom Hearts and coexisted with it. The war broke the X-Blade into 20 pieces: seven of light and thirteen of darkness. Kingdom Hearts was swallowed by darkness since the X-Blade broke. The hearts of children helped the world illuminate albeit separated.

Xehanort's Plan

When Xehanort arrived at the Land of Departure, he was interested in the Keyblade War. Xehanort made a plan to remake the historical event. Since Xehanort is old, he wanted to find a vessel so he can extend his life. He once picked Ventus who failed. Xehanort extracted Ven's darkness and created a man named Vanitas. Xehanort wanted Ven and Vanitas to fuse to forge the X-Blade. Xehanort noticed the weapon was forged. Xehanort used Terra as his vessel. Xehanort came across Terra's keyblade armor and battled it. Since it was 1/10th complete, the X-Blade broke and Xehanort got amnesia. However, Xehanort made back up plans. Braig who is another vessel of Xehanort helped Xehanort regain his memories. Xehanort, Braig, Dilan, Ienzo, Aeleus and Even worked on creating Heartless until Ansem banned their work. They later banished Ansem to the Realm of Darkness. Xehanort regained his memories and stabbed Braig. He declared that is not Xehanort but "Ansem". Xehanort worked on Ansem's reports until he became a Heartless and a Nobody named "Ansem" and "Xemnas", respectively. Ansem was tasked to work with Maleficent, Xehanort's ally to find the Princesses of Heart and open the door to the blackened Kingdom Hearts along with the worlds he have destroyed. Xemnas is tasked to create Organization XIII for a specific reason: round up a bunch of emptied husks, hook them up to Kingdom Hearts and transform them into 13 Xehanorts. However, through weakness of body, will or trust, most of the members were inadequate. Thus naturally, they never had a chance to attain their goal. Even this was to be expected. As a backup plan, Ansem time traveled to Xehanort as a teenager at Destiny Islands to find 12 future versions of Xehanort. Both of Ansem and Xemnas' plans were foiled by Sora. The deaths led to the return of Master Xehanort. At the Mark of Mastery exam, Xehanort and his comrades revealed their plan to Sora and his friends. Xehanort and his friends retreated back to their normal time to get prepared for the final battle. Yen Sid wanted seven keyblade wielders to protect the princesses. The Guardians of Light are: Sora, Mickey, Riku, Aqua, Terra, Ventus and Kairi (who got her ability when inadvertently touching Aqua's keyblade).
name: χ-Blade

deck: Armor suits worn by keyblade wielders.
description:
Origins

Keyblade Armor was probably made during or after the Keyblade War. Master Xehanort once worn it but replaced it with a black cloak (The outfit of Xehanort's Organization XIII). Xehanort used Terra as a vessel. Terra's soul animated his keyblade armor. It became known as the Lingering Will. When Aqua sent Xehanort to Radiant Garden from the darkness, she gave her Keyblade Armor and keyblade to him. The items were taken to the Chamber of Repose after sending Ansem to the realm of Darkness. After becoming a nobody, Xemnas goes to the chamber to remember his previous lifes as Terra and Xehanort. When battling Sora and Riku, Xemnas is wearing Master Xehanort's keyblade armor. After reading the message, Sora found a portal to the Keyblade Graveyard where he met the Lingering Will. The Will confused Sora with Aqua, Ventus, Riku and Xehanort. When the Will thought that Sora is Xehanort. It started attacking Sora, Donald and Goofy. After its defeat, it realized it attacked the wrong person and acknowledged Sora as a Keyblade Master.
name: Keyblade Armor

deck: The first M.A.C.H. armor created and worn by Abe Jenkins.
description:
History

The Mobile Armored Cyber-Harness is a new armor built by Jenkins to replace his old Beetle armor and alias to become Mach-I after joining the Thunderbolts.

Capabilities

On-board cameras gave it a 360 degree field of view. It was capable of high speeds.

Machine guns were loaded with conventional and rubber 'mercy' rounds. Two heat-seeking missiles were mounted. A gas grenade launcher was used for smokescreens or tear gas. The armor could generate a photon burst for illumination or to temporarily blind enemies. It also had blasters.

description:
Abe Jenkins wore the Mk. II Beetle Armor for the longest time before re-establishing himself as a hero known as MACH-I with a new set of armor entirely. He later developed a new Mk. III Beetle armor.

Abe returned to wearing his classic Mk. II Beetle Armor when he was leading the Thunderbolts and his MACH-IV armor was damaged.

The Mk. II Beetle armor was later stolen by a student called Elizabeth Vaughn, who with two friends who had stolen different models of the armor, joined the Initiative and the Thunderbolts.

Stolen models of the Mk. II armor were later being sold by criminals in New York.

deck: A new Beetle armor worn by the current Beetle, Janice. Unlike the other Beetle armors, this one was not created by Abe Jenkins and was instead based on designs which were stolen by Baron Zemo.
description: The Mk. IV seems to be, aesthetically, strongly based on the Mk. II Beetle armor rather than the bulkier Mk. III armor. Janice received the armor from Baron Zemo, who wished to use her as a foot-soldier in a campaign against Captain America. She continued to wear the armor afterwards and joined the Sinister Six.

deck: A suit designed and made by Hank Pym for military use which allows the wearer access to Pym Particles. Worn by Eric o'Grady and briefly Chris McCarthy.
description:
Overview

The suit was made by Hank Pym for SHIELD use. The suit gains most of its abilities from the helmet, which grant the user the ability to talk to ants while it also houses a HUD and holds the Pym Particles for growth and shrinking. The suit also has bionic legs with built in jets that can be used for fast travel. The suit can be stored in the helmet when not using suit for longer periods of time.
